DataElement.preferredName: Study Protocol Investigational New Drug Or Investigational Medical Device Exemption Flag Non-Protocol Access Status Code ExpandedAccessStatus
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.:Immunity from an obligation or duty.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true._Treatment not specified in a protocol.:The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching.:A condition or state at a particular time.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._The code that describes the status indicating availability of an experimental drug or device outside any clinical trial protocol.

Also, an act or means of approaching.:A condition or state at a particular time.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Study Protocol Investigational New Drug Or Investigational Medical Device Exemption Flag
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Concepts.definition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.
Immunity from an obligation or duty.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.:The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching.:A condition or state at a particular time.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.
The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching.
A condition or state at a particular time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/22/2021wz: released for UML model cleanup project.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that describes the status indicating availability of an experimental drug or device outside any clinical trial protocol.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The commercial processes involved in promoting and selling and distributing a product or service.:Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

Concepts.definition: The commercial processes involved in promoting and selling and distributing a product or service.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring prior to something else.:The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Occurring prior to something else.
The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not permanent; not lasting; lacking continuity or regularity.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Not permanent; not lasting; lacking continuity or regularity.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.
